maml:description.maml:para: Displays information about the OSDWorkspace PowerShell Module.
Dislays information about the OSDWorkspace PowerShell Module including Upcoming Events, Links to Resources, and Newest Functions.

dev:type.maml:name: You cannot pipe input to this cmdlet.
This function does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information about the OSDWorkspace PowerShell Module.

maml:description.maml:para: Clones a GitHub Repository into C:\OSDWorkspace\Library-GitHub

This function clones a specified GitHub repository into the OSDWorkspace Library-GitHub directory. Performs a fetch and clean operation to ensure the repository is up to date and free of untracked files. If you have already cloned the repository, use the Update-OSDWorkspaceGitHubRepo cmdlet to update it.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clones the repository 'OSDWorkspace-MichaelEscamilla' into the OSDWorkspace Library-GitHub directory.

This function does not return any output.

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the winre.wim from a mounted Windows Installation Media ISO to the OSDWorkspace BootImage directory.

Imports the winre.wim from a mounted Windows Installation Media ISO to the OSDWorkspace BootImage directory. Supports both Windows 11 24H2 amd64 and arm64 Windows Installation Media ISO. Will display a Out-GridView of the available Indexes for each Mounted Windows Installation Media ISO. Select one or multiple Indexes to import. The BootImage will be imported to the OSDWorkspace BootImage directory with a name of the format "yyMMdd-HHmmss Architecture".

dev:type.maml:name: You cannot pipe input to this cmdlet.
This function does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Imports the winre.wim from a mounted Windows Installation Media ISO to the OSDWorkspace BootImage directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new OSDWorkspace BootMedia.
This function creates a new OSDWorkspace BootMedia by copying the selected BootImage and adding the Windows ADK Optional Components. The BootMedia is created in the OSDWorkspace BootMedia directory.
Name to append to the BootMedia Id.
Windows ADK Languages to add to the BootImage. Default is en-US.
Sets all International settings in WinPE to the specified language. Default is en-US.
Sets the default InputLocale in WinPE to the specified Input Locale. Default is en-US.
Set the WinPE TimeZone. Default is the current TimeZone.
Select the Windows ADK version to use if multiple versions are present in the cache.
Skip adding the Windows ADK Optional Components. Useful for quick testing of the Library.
Uses the Windows ADK winpe.wim instead of an imported BootImage.
Architecture of the BootImage. This is automatically set when selected a existing BootImage. This is required when using the Windows ADK winpe.wim.
Update a OSDWorkspace USB drive with the new BootMedia.
Name to append to the BootMedia Id.
Windows ADK Languages to add to the BootImage. Default is en-US.
Sets all International settings in WinPE to the specified language. Default is en-US.
Sets the default InputLocale in WinPE to the specified Input Locale. Default is en-US.
Set the WinPE TimeZone. Default is the current TimeZone.
Select the Windows ADK version to use if multiple versions are present in the cache.
Skip adding the Windows ADK Optional Components. Useful for quick testing of the Library.
Architecture of the BootImage. This is automatically set when selected a existing BootImage. This is required when using the Windows ADK winpe.wim.
Update a OSDWorkspace USB drive with the new BootMedia.
Name to append to the BootMedia Id.
Windows ADK Languages to add to the BootImage. Default is en-US.
Sets all International settings in WinPE to the specified language. Default is en-US.
Sets the default InputLocale in WinPE to the specified Input Locale. Default is en-US.
Set the WinPE TimeZone. Default is the current TimeZone.
Select the Windows ADK version to use if multiple versions are present in the cache.
Skip adding the Windows ADK Optional Components. Useful for quick testing of the Library.
Uses the Windows ADK winpe.wim instead of an imported BootImage.
Architecture of the BootImage. This is automatically set when selected a existing BootImage. This is required when using the Windows ADK winpe.wim.
Update a OSDWorkspace USB drive with the new BootMedia.

dev:type.maml:name: You cannot pipe input to this cmdlet.
This function does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new OSDWorkspace 'amd64' BootMedia with the name 'MyBootMedia'.
Creates a new OSDWorkspace 'arm64' BootMedia with the name 'MyBootMedia'.
Creates a new OSDWorkspace 'amd64' BootMedia using the Windows ADK winpe.wim with the name 'MyBootMedia'.
Creates a new OSDWorkspace 'arm64' BootMedia with the name 'MyBootMedia' and prompts to select the Windows ADK version to use.
Creates a new OSDWorkspace BootMedia with the name 'MyBootMedia', architecture 'amd64' and languages 'en-US' and 'fr-FR'.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new OSDWorkspace USB.
This function creates a new OSDWorkspace USB by selecting a boot media and performing necessary checks and operations.
Label for the boot partition. Default is 'WINPE'.
Label for the data partition. Default is 'USB Data'.
Label for the boot partition. Default is 'WINPE'.
Label for the data partition. Default is 'USB Data'.

dev:type.maml:name: You cannot pipe input to this cmdlet.
This function does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new OSDWorkspace USB with default labels for boot and data partitions.
Creates a new OSDWorkspace USB with the boot label 'MYBOOT' and data label 'MYDATA'.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Hyper-V VM for use with OSDWorkspace
Creates a Hyper-V VM for use with OSDWorkspace
Specifies whether to create a checkpoint of the VM after creation. Default is $true.
Specifies the generation of the VM. Default is 2.
Specifies the amount of memory in whole number GB to allocate to the VM. Default is 10. Maximum is 64.
Specifies the prefix to use for the VM name. Default is 'OSDWorkspace'. Full VM name will be in the format 'yyMMdd-HHmmss 'NamePrefix' BootMediaName'.
Specifies the number of processors to allocate to the VM. Default is 2. Maximum is 64.
Specifies whether to start the VM after creation. Default is $true.

Specifies the name of the virtual switch to connect the VM to. If not specified, an Out-GridView will be displayed to select a switch. If no switches are found, the VM will be created without a network connection.
Specifies the size of the VHD in whole number GB. Default is 64. Maximum is 128.
Specifies whether to create a checkpoint of the VM after creation. Default is $true.
Specifies the generation of the VM. Default is 2.
Specifies the amount of memory in whole number GB to allocate to the VM. Default is 10. Maximum is 64.
Specifies the prefix to use for the VM name. Default is 'OSDWorkspace'. Full VM name will be in the format 'yyMMdd-HHmmss 'NamePrefix' BootMediaName'.
Specifies the number of processors to allocate to the VM. Default is 2. Maximum is 64.
Specifies whether to start the VM after creation. Default is $true.

Specifies the name of the virtual switch to connect the VM to. If not specified, an Out-GridView will be displayed to select a switch. If no switches are found, the VM will be created without a network connection.
Specifies the size of the VHD in whole number GB. Default is 64. Maximum is 128.

dev:type.maml:name: You cannot pipe input to this cmdlet.
This function does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a Hyper-V VM for use with OSDWorkspace
Creates a Generation 2 Hyper-V VM with 8GB of memory, 4 processors, 1920x1080 display resolution, and a 50GB VHD. The VM will not be started and will not have an Initial checkpoint created.

maml:description.maml:para: Opens the OSDWorkspace in VS Code or the specified Application.
Opens the OSDWorkspace in VS Code or the specified Applications.
The application to open the OSDWorkspace in. Valid values are 'code', 'Explorer', and 'Terminal'. Default is 'code'.
The application to open the OSDWorkspace in. Valid values are 'code', 'Explorer', and 'Terminal'. Default is 'code'.

dev:type.maml:name: You cannot pipe input to this cmdlet.
This function does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Opens the OSDWorkspace in Visual Studio Code.
Opens the OSDWorkspace in Windows Explorer.
Opens the OSDWorkspace in Windows Terminal.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a GitHub Repository in C:\OSDWorkspace\Library-GitHub from the GitHub Origin

This function updates ALL GitHub repositories in the OSDWorkspace Library-GitHub directory. The function will update this Git repository to the latest GitHub commit in the main branch. It performs a fetch and clean operation to ensure the repository is up to date and free of untracked files. If you have not cloned the repository, use Import-OSDWorkspaceGitHubRepo to clone it.
The -Force switch is Required to update the GitHub repository. This will overwrite any local changes to the repository.
The -Force switch is Required to update the GitHub repository. This will overwrite any local changes to the repository.

dev:type.maml:name: You cannot pipe input to this cmdlet.
This function does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates all GitHub repositories in the OSDWorkspace Library-GitHub directory to the latest GitHub commit in the main branch.
